BR_text.BRsummary: x data is getting dropped in plotly charts
BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
 
 When including a Plotly chart inside of a beta_expander, the x data of Plotly charts is sometimes getting dropped in a weird way.
 <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
 
 test.py
 <denchmark-code>import streamlit as st
 import plotly.express as px
 
 
 with st.beta_expander("Test"):
     y_data = [0.2211651, 0.65165161, 0.65165464, 0.6546549849]
     x_data = ["this", "is", "a", "test"]
     fig = px.bar(x=x_data, y=y_data)
     st.plotly_chart(fig, use_container_width=True)
 </denchmark-code>
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
 
 The plotly chart should remain consistent across collapse/expand actions, and should not be losing chart information.
 <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
 
 Expand and collapse and you'll see that the hover info for x disappears. If you hit "reset axes" the x labels go away too.
 If you edit the list (eg. swap "this" -> "ok" in x_data) and hover over the chart again, the hover data appears fixed. However, if you collapse and expand the container, it goes back away.
 <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
 
 
 Streamlit version: 0.69.2
 Python version: 3.7.9
 Conda environment
 Browser version: Observed in Chrome, Brave, and Safari

comments_0.comment_text: It looks like these issues are not specific to the expander and is reproducible without any expanders on the page
